titlepage.titleproper: Guide to the Joseph D. Cusick Papers relating to Lockheed Missiles & Space Co. and the U.S. Air Force, 1962-1991

Stanford, California

did.head: Descriptive Summary
did.unittitle: Cusick, Joseph D.: Papers relating to Lockheed Missiles & Space Co. and the U.S. Air Force Satellite Test Center,

repository.label: Repository
repository.corpname: Stanford University. Libraries. Dept. of Special Collections and University Archives.

did.abstract: History, policies, organization, personnel, and technical training materials collected by Joseph D. Cusick during employment. Includes the serial, TRW Space Log, 1968-1979.

userestrict.head: Publication Rights
userestrict.p: Property rights reside with the repository. Literary rights reside with the creators of the documents or their heirs. To obtain permission to publish or reproduce, please contact the Public Services Librarian of the Dept. of Special Collections.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Joseph D. Cusick Papers relating to Lockheed Missiles & Space Co. and the U.S. Ar Force. M1003. Dept. of Special Collections, Stanford University Libraries, Stanford, Calif.

scopecontent.head: Collection Scope and Content Summary
scopecontent.p: History, policies, organization, personnel, and technical trainingmaterials collected by Joseph D. Cusick during employment by Lockheed Missiles & Space Co. (LMSC) from August 1962 to May 1968 and the U.S. Air Force, at the Air Force Satellite Test Center [Satellite Operations Center] Onizuka Air Force Base, Sunnyvale, CA), from May 1962 through May 1991.

controlaccess.head: Access Terms
controlaccess.p: The following terms have been used to index the description of this collection in the library's online public access catalog.
controlaccess.corpname: United States. Air Force. Satellite Control Facility.
controlaccess.subject: Science--History.

did.unittitle: History of Scheduling, Air Force Satellite Control Facility (AFSCF) 1962-1966
AFSCF Satellite Operations Resource Analysis reports 1963-1966
AFSCF Operations Procedures History 1965-1970
Air Force/Navy/Army Interrange Operations Planning Group proceedings with trip report to Cape Kennedy AFS, Florida 1966
"2001": A U.S. Space Force", paper from 1981 Air University Airpower Symposium at Maxwell Air Force Base, Alabama 1981
AFSCF Historical Brief and Chronology 1954-1982
AFSCF operations Manual (policies and procedures for operating the satellite operations network), initial publication with changes 1966-1968
Conversion of contractor positions from Lockheed to Air Force 1967-1968
Personal files of J.D. Cusick during conversion process; correspondence with LMSC
Papers establishing a GS-14 supervisory position in 1970
History of Operations Policies and Procedures, indexed 1972
AFSCF Program Control 1973-1974
Policy files from 6594 Aerospace Test Wing to AFSCF, 1962-1963
Satellite Test Operations history Reports 1962-1975
History of Operation Activation of Consolidated Space Operations Center (CSOC), U.S.Space Command) Falcon AFB, Colorado Springs, CO 1981-1991
Management Plan to prepare and executre training and transfer of operations personnel from Sunnyvale to Colorado Springs
Graduation of first class of Air Force Satellite Control Officers
renaming ceremony: Sunnyvale AFS to Onizuka AFB and transfer of facility from Air Force Systems Command to Space Command
Contracts with Lockheed and Loral to train military satellite operators
Photographs of construction of Consolidated Space Operations Center
operational Activation of Consolidated Space Operations Center history Reports 1981-1991
Reorganization of Consolidated Space Test Command (CSTC) for MILSTAR training program 1989-1991
Travel files of J.D. Cusick as Department of the Air Force Civilian 1968-1991

training records and course materials for LMSC, Air Force Institute of Technology, U.S. Army traiing Center, Civil Service Executive Seminare Centers in Berkeley, California and Oak ridge, Tennessee, Sloan Reports from Stanford Business School 1972-1973
